item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All art is quite useless." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Norman O. Brown
item.description: "Meaning is not in things but in between them." -- Norman O. Brown

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Everyone looks retarded once you set your mind to it." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description:
"If I could believe in myself, why not give other improbabilities the benefit of the doubt? I accepted the idea that an omniscient God had cast me in his own image and that he watched over me and guided me from one place to the next. The virgin birth, the resurrection, and the countless miracles -my heart expanded to encompass all the wonders and possibilities of the universe.
A bell, though, that's fucked up." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "My chief occupation, despite appearances, has always been love." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sarah Louise add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "But when the strong were too weak to hurt the weak, the weak had to be strong enough to leave." -- Milan Kundera
